chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child
Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon M Amato was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon M Amato is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon M Amato was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Brandon M Amato was found guilty of Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).
  • Brandon M Amato was found guilty of Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $268 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $250 DNA surcharge remitted.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KMM, JSH, MAQ, KLM. Defn shall not access the internet for the purposes of social media activity. No unsupervised contact w/juveniles. Not to access pornographic material.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 if successful completion of probation (ct 1 only).
Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.   Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

of judge (demand)

Bail amended to:
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with K.M.M., J.S.H., M.A.Q., or K.L.M.
- Defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact with any juvenile female.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not access the Internet for the purposes of any social media activitiy.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.
  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
